questions.question: Which muscle is the main dorsiflexor of the foot?
questions.explanation: Tibialis anterior is the primary dorsiflexor of the foot. It also assists in inversion of the foot.

questions.question: What structure passes through the femoral triangle?
options: A. Femoral nerve, artery, and vein
questions.explanation: The femoral triangle contains (from lateral to medial): Femoral Nerve, Femoral Artery, Femoral Vein, and Lymphatics (NAVEL).

metadata.description: Lower limb bones, muscles, nerves, and clinical correlations
